intro: Jacaratia dodecaphylla f. longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered jacaratia, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, showy inflorescences that resemble candles, which are a distinguishing feature of the species. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female parts. This plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological roles in its native habitats.
